transcript.text: Here are some people who thought they were helping–but they actually put their companies at serious risk. Select each person to learn more.

contentText.text: You can see why competitive information would be valuable! But no matter how helpful it could be, we should never accept competitive information that is gained through illegal or unethical actions such as those outlined below.

instructionText.text: Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

popText.text: I called a competitor pretending to be a client. I thought learning about their pricing would help me compete against them.
One night after work, I checked the dumpsters outside of a competitor’s offices. Sure enough, I was able to find some information about their new product releases.
I paid a former employee to give me the passwords to a company’s networks. I got a lot of great information and no one even knew I’d been in there.

I met with a client before we submitted a bid for an upcoming project. During the meeting, he left the room briefly and said that I should take a look in the folder on his desk. When I opened it, it was our competitor’s bid, including their pricing. I used the information to submit a better offer.
